meanings.definition: The belief or practice of being exceptional or exceptional qualities.
meanings.sent1: Her exceptionalisms in kindness and generosity set her apart from others.
meanings.sent2: His exceptionalisms in leadership and innovation made him stand out in the company.
meanings.sent3: Despite his exceptionalisms in punctuality, he was always late to his own parties.
meanings.sent4: Her exceptionalisms in creativity were like a beacon of light in the dull office environment.
meanings.sent5: The exceptionalisms of her talent left a lasting impression on everyone who saw her perform.

meanings.definition: The state of being an exception; an exceptional case.
meanings.sent1: The doctor was puzzled by the exceptionalisms in the patient's test results.
meanings.sent2: In a sea of similar stories, hers was an exceptionalisms that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The exceptionalisms of the cat who loved water was a source of amusement for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: His exceptionalisms in always finding the silver lining inspired those around him.
meanings.sent5: The exceptionalisms of the situation made it a topic of discussion for weeks to come.
